required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of Cervical Pessary Versus Vaginal Progesterone for the Prevention of Preterm Birth in Women With Singleton Pregnancies and Short Cervix: a Multicenter Randomized Controlled Trial

collaborator.agency: My Duc Phu Nhuan Hospital HCMC, Vietnam
Quang Ninh Obstetrics and Pediatrics Hospital, Quang Ninh, Vietnam

brief_summary.textblock:
This study compares the effectiveness of cervical pessary to vaginal progesterone for prevention of preterm birth in women with singleton pregnancies and a cervix ≤25 mm.
Participants will be randomly assigned in a 1:1 ratio to receive cervical pessary or vaginal progesterone.

detailed_description.textblock:
This open label, multi-center, randomized controlled trial aims to compare the effectiveness of cervical pessary to vaginal progesterone for prevention of PTB in women with singleton pregnancies and a cervix ≤25 mm.
All women at 16 0/7 to 22 0/7 weeks with singleton pregnancies will undergo cervical length (CL) measurement and digital examination at screening routinely. Women with a CL ≤25 mm will be eligible for the study.
Subjects meeting the study criteria will be randomized into two groups: (1) treated with cervical pessary (Arabin) or (2) treated with 200 mg vaginal progesterone, once daily.
After written informed consent, women will be randomly assigned in a 1:1 ratio to receive a cervical pessary or progesterone. Assignment to treatment allocation will be done via a web portal hosted by HOPE Research Center, Vietnam. The randomization schedule will be computer-generated at HOPE Research Center, with a permuted random block size of 2, 4 or 6. Blinding will not be possible due to the nature of interventions.
For those who randomised to pessary group, a pessary certified by European Conformity (Arabin®, Dr Arabin GmbH & Co KG, Germany) will be inserted through the vagina, upward around the cervix by 2-4 senior clinicians, who had experienced with pessary used at each site, within one week of randomization.
Women allocated to progesterone group will be receiving 200 mg vaginal progesterone, purchased from the manufacturer (Cyclogest® 200 mg, Actavis, United Kingdom), once daily at bedtime. They will be given a monitoring sheet and instructed to note everyday the date of using.
In case of premature rupture of membranes, active vaginal bleeding, other signs of preterm labor or severe patient discomfort, the pessary may be removed. If participants develop (threatened) preterm labor, they will receive treatment per local protocol. Intervention will be stopped at 370/7 weeks of gestation or at delivery.
Along side with this trial, another study will be conducted to determine how changes in peripheral blood and cervical inflammatory markers are impacted by progesterone versus pessary. Because of that, participants will be asked to take 5 ml blood sample and cervical-vaginal discharge sampling at the time of randomization, 4-8 weeks after randomization and before giving birth.
A cost-effectiveness analysis will also be conducted alongside this RCT. Data will be reported in a separated paper.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants will be randomised to either pessary or progesterone in a 1:1 ratio with a variable block size of 2, 4 or 6.

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of preterm birth <37 weeks of gestation by any cause
primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomisation until 36 6/7 weeks

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At birth
secondary_outcome.description: Gestational age at delivery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomisation until the date of delivery.
secondary_outcome.description: Time interval between randomisation and delivery

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of preterm birth before 28 weeks of gestation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomisation until 27 6/7 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Birth before 28 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of preterm birth before 34 weeks of gestation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomisation until 33 6/7 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Birth before 34 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of spontaneous preterm birth <28 weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomisation until 27 6/7 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Birth spontaneously before 28 weeks' gestation, including preterm spontaneous rupture of membranes, preterm premature rupture of membranes (PPROM)

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of spontaneous preterm birth <34 weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomisation until 33 6/7 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Birth spontaneously before 34 weeks' gestation, including preterm spontaneous rupture of membranes, preterm premature rupture of membranes (PPROM)

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of spontaneous preterm birth <37 weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomisation until 36 6/7 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Birth spontaneously before 37 weeks' gestation, including preterm spontaneous rupture of membranes, preterm premature rupture of membranes (PPROM)

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of iatrogenic preterm birth <28 weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomisation until 27 6/7 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Birth non-spontaneously before 28 weeks' gestation

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of iatrogenic preterm birth <34 weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomisation until 33 6/7 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Birth non-spontaneously before 34 weeks' gestation

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of iatrogenic preterm birth <37 weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomisation until 36 6/7 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Birth non-spontaneously before 37 weeks' gestation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At birth
secondary_outcome.description: Spontaneous, labor induction, elective C-section

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At birth
secondary_outcome.description: Vaginal delivery, C-section (elective, suspected fetal distress, non-progressive labor)

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of all live births at any gestational age
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At birth
secondary_outcome.description: The birth of at least one newborn, regardless of gestational age, that exhibits any sign of life such as respiration, heartbeat, umbilical pulsation or movement of voluntary muscles

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of use of tocolytic drugs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 0/7 to 36 6/7 weeks' gestation
secondary_outcome.description: Use of any tocolytic drug to treat preterm labour

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of use of antenatal corticosteroids
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 0/7 to 36 6/7 weeks' gestation
secondary_outcome.description: Use of antenatal corticosteroids to prevent respiratory distressed syndrome

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of use of MgSO4 for neuroprotection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 28 0/7 to 31 6/7 weeks' gestation
secondary_outcome.description: Use of MgSO4 for neuroprotection

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of preterm premature rupture of membranes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to less than 37 weeks, up to 21 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Prelabour rupture of membranes and gestational age less than 37 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of maternal admission for preterm labor (days)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to 37 week
secondary_outcome.description: Number of admission days for treatment of preterm labour

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to delivery, up to 28 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Intraamniotic infection

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization to delivery, up to 28 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Death of the mother

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At birth
secondary_outcome.description: Weight of baby born

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At birth
secondary_outcome.description: Weight of baby born <1500g

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At birth
secondary_outcome.description: Weight of baby born <2500g

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At birth
secondary_outcome.description: Any congenital anomalies detected in baby born

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At birth
secondary_outcome.description: Apgar score at 5 minute after birth. 5-minute Apgar score of 7-10 as reassuring, a score of 4-6 as moderately abnormal, and a score of 0-3 as low in the term infant and late-preterm infant.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At birth
secondary_outcome.description: Apgar score at 5 minute after birth <7. An increased relative risk of cerebral palsy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of admission to neonatal intensive care unit (NICU)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days of life after the due day
secondary_outcome.description: Admission to neonatal intensive care unit of baby

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days of life after the due day
secondary_outcome.description: Number of admission days to NICU

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days of life after the due day
secondary_outcome.description: Death of newborn before discharge from nursery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days of life after the due day
secondary_outcome.description: Death of a live-born infant within the first 28 days of life after the due day

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 20 weeks of gestation to 28 days of life after the due day
secondary_outcome.description: Intrauterine fetal death after 20 weeks of gestation, or neonatal death

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After 20 weeks of gestation until the date of delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Baby born with no signs of life at or after 20 weeks' gestation

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of composite of poor perinatal outcomes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days of life after the due day
secondary_outcome.description: Foetal or neonatal death, intraventricular haemorrhage, respiratory distress syndrome, necrotizing enterocolitis or neonatal sepsis

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days of life after the due day
secondary_outcome.description: presence of tachypnoea >60/minute, sternal recession and expiratory grunting, need for supplemental oxygen, and a radiological picture of diffuse reticulogranular shadowing with an air bronchogram

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of periventricular haemorrhage II B or worse
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days of life after the due day
secondary_outcome.description: Repeated neonatal cranial ultrasound by the neonatologist according to the guidelines on neuro-imaging described by de Vries et al

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days of life after the due day
secondary_outcome.description: Diagnosed according to Bell

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 28 days of life after the due day
secondary_outcome.description: The combination of clinical signs and positive blood cultures

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of maternal vaginal side effects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomisation until delivery, which is up to 24 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Including vaginal discharge, vaginal bleeding, vaginal infection (confirmed by vaginal discharge culture)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomisation until delivery, which is up to 24 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluated by VAS numerical rating scale. Assessments with units on a Scale.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomisation until delivery, which is up to 24 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: After pessary initial placement, requiring to reposition the pessary by any reasons

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of maternal cervical side effects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomisation until delivery, which is up to 24 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Including necrosis or rupture of the cervix, cervical laceration

arm_group.description: Cervical pessary (Arabin) will be inserted to participants at 16-22 weeks and removed at 37 weeks of pregnancy or in case of premature rupture of membranes, signs of preterm labour or patient severe discomfort.

Vaginal progesterone (Cyclogest 200 mg) once a day will be used, from 16-22 to 37 weeks of pregnancy or in case of premature rupture of membranes, signs of preterm labour or patient severe discomfort.

intervention.description: Arabin (cervical pessary) will be inserted at 16-22 weeks and removed at 37 weeks of pregnancy or in case of premature rupture of membranes, signs of preterm labour or patient severe discomfort

Vaginal progesterone (Cyclogest 200 mg) once a day will be used, from 16-22 to 37 weeks of pregnancy or in case of premature rupture of membranes, signs of preterm labour or patient severe discomfort.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Singleton pregnancies
- Cervical length ≤ 25 mm, measured by TVS at the second-trimester ultrasonography (16 0/7-22 0/7 weeks of gestation)
- Not participating in any other study which has intervention on maternity or fetus at the same time
- Provision of written informed consent to participate as shown by a signature on the patient consent form.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cervical dilation with visible amniotic membranes or amniotic membranes prolapsed into the vagina
- Major congenital abnormalities of the fetus
- Presence of severe vaginal discharge
- Presence of vaginitis or cervicitis
- Presence of vaginal bleeding
- Preterm premature rupture of membranes
- Premature labor without ruptured membrane at the time of screening
- Suspected chorioamnionitis
- Unable to have cervical pessary inserted
- Cerclage or pessary in place

facility.name: Quang Ninh Obstetrics and Pediatrics Hospital
